criteria: Identification of Commemorative Holidays, People, and Events
Understanding of the Purposes of Commemorative Holidays
Knowledge of the Human Struggles Behind Commemorative Events
descriptions: The student does not identify any commemorative holidays, people, or events.
The student identifies at least one commemorative holiday, person, or event, but with significant inaccuracies.
The student identifies some commemorative holidays, people, and events, but with limited detail and some inaccuracies.
The student identifies most of the major commemorative holidays, people, and events with reasonable accuracy.
The student accurately identifies the major commemorative holidays, people, and events with specific details.
The student accurately identifies the major commemorative holidays, people, and events with specific details and provides additional relevant information beyond what was taught in class.
The student does not demonstrate any understanding of the purposes of commemorative holidays.
The student attempts to explain the purpose of a holiday, but the explanation is unclear or incorrect.
The student provides a basic explanation of the purpose of some holidays, but lacks depth or accuracy in several areas.
The student provides a clear explanation of the purpose of most holidays, with a few minor inaccuracies.
The student provides a clear and accurate explanation of the purpose of the major holidays.
The student provides a clear and accurate explanation of the purpose of the major holidays and relates them to contemporary issues or events.
The student demonstrates no awareness of the human struggles that led to the commemorative events.
The student mentions the concept of struggle in relation to the event, but provides no specific details.
The student identifies a human struggle associated with some commemorative events, but the explanation lacks detail or accuracy.
The student describes the human struggles associated with most commemorative events with reasonable accuracy.
The student clearly and accurately describes the human struggles associated with the major commemorative events, including specific details.
The student clearly and accurately describes the human struggles associated with the major commemorative events, including specific details, and connects these struggles to broader themes in history.
